snippet: Greek banks and hedge funds have offered to sell back close to €26 billion in bonds, short of the government's goal of €30 billion.
abstract: Greece, on verge of completing crucial plan to reduce its debt burden, extends deadline for foreign investors and Greek banks to sell their deeply discounted bonds back to the government; banks and hedge funds have offered to sell back close to 26 billion euros ($33.6 billion) in bonds, short of the government's goal of 30 billion euros.
lead_paragraph: Greek banks and hedge funds have offered to sell back close to €26 billion in bonds, short of the government's goal of €30 billion.

headline.main: More Time For Investors To Sell Back Greek Debt
headline.print_headline: More Time For Investors To Sell Back Greek Debt
